content.body: Ah, Domenic left a comment already

Noam Rosenthal: so for navigation timing, where do we actually set navigation start currently? In your presentation you mentioned it might be before unload runs, but in the specification it seems all it gets is timing information from fetch, which would be a later point in time
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: so for navigation timing, where do we actually set navigation start currently? In your presentation you mentioned it might be before unload runs, but in the specification it seems all it gets is timing information from fetch, which would be a later point in time

content.body:
> <@annevk:mozilla.org> Noam Rosenthal: so for navigation timing, where do we actually set navigation start currently? In your presentation you mentioned it might be before unload runs, but in the specification it seems all it gets is timing information from fetch, which would be a later point in time

It’s specified in the HRtime spec

https://www.w3.org/TR/hr-time-3/#sec-time-origin
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
Noam Rosenthal: so for navigation timing, where do we actually set navigation start currently? In your presentation you mentioned it might be before unload runs, but in the specification it seems all it gets is timing information from fetch, which would be a later point in time

It’s specified in the HRtime spec

https://www.w3.org/TR/hr-time-3/#sec-time-origin

content.body:
The other parts are relative to that time origin

It would be better to move it into HTML to make it explicit
content.formatted_body:
The other parts are relative to that time origin

It would be better to move it into HTML to make it explicit

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: yeah, I would have expected HTML to create a time entry, similar to what we do for the other things
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: yeah, I would have expected HTML to create a time entry, similar to what we do for the other things
